div.head: ¶Amantissimo suo amico Philippo Mooro, Guilhelmus Bullenus. S. P. D.
div.p: PRopter singularem erga te amorem meum [mi Phylippe] librum tuum notis quibusdā marginalibus adornaui, tum vt mutua amicitia nostra stabiliretur, tū vt īspectoribus omnibus certa speretur salus. Ne{que} arroganter, hoc a me scriptū esse existimes velim, vt opusculo tuo colores adderem, sed vt celeri festinationi tuae opitularer.

div.head: ¶W. Bullein ones again to. P. M.
div.l: Deus effudit in totum genus mortalium,
Many medicens, dere frende P. Moore:
Artem medendi doloribus. For the sicke and the sore,
Herbas salubres. Who so doeth them dispise,
Benombred emong the fooles, & abiectes frō the wise
Thy hope of Health, haue many goodly rules in store
Farewell gentle frende, God be praised therefore.
